intro: Trigonostemon filiformis, commonly known as the slender-leaved trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
